project_info.title: MIB2 Controller enables legitimate automotive repair

outline.title: MIB2 Controller enables legitimate automotive repair
outline.summary: Introduction to MIB2 Controller as a professional diagnostic tool for authorized repair, with target users and legal framework under DMCA exemptions.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/s2Z6plv4HNrW.jpg - Image 5 shows an automotive technician working on a car's interior, which visually supports the theme of specialized automotive repair and diagnostics.

outline.title: Four core features address critical repair needs
outline.summary: Overview of Auto-Spoof, FEC Code Management, Telnet Diagnostic Access, and Backup & Restore features with their repair applications.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/JYH7av5dCCTa.jpg - Image 6 shows a technician using a digital tool for diagnostics, reinforcing the concept of digital tools for repair and the four core features.

outline.title: Specialized hardware requirements limit access
outline.summary: Detailed breakdown of required equipment (MIB2 unit, USB-Ethernet adapter, OTG cable, Android device) with costs and availability restrictions.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/jnvXDNHOkFyy.jpg; /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/J9e4nVZ4HNgN.jpg - Images 7 and 8 show the specialized USB-Ethernet and OTG cables required, directly illustrating the hardware requirements discussed on the slide.

outline.title: All communication is local with zero data collection
outline.summary: Network architecture showing exclusive local communication via USB Ethernet, no external servers, and comprehensive privacy compliance.

outline.title: Legal compliance under DMCA exemptions
outline.summary: Detailed explanation of applicable DMCA exemptions (37 C.F.R. ยง 201.40) for vehicle repair, interoperability, and security research.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/Gp8Gehbb9Ear.jpg; /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/lXBb41WUDhDZ.jpg; /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/1sDIaf7AeAwc.jpg - Images 1, 2, and 3 are professional diagnostic tools, which visually support the legal compliance section by showing the "identical legal framework" used by established tools.

outline.title: Testing without hardware through alternative methods
outline.summary: Five alternative verification methods for reviewers: UI review, APK analysis, demo mode, video demonstration, and remote testing assistance.

outline.title: Comprehensive documentation ensures transparency
outline.summary: Overview of in-app documentation, external documentation (privacy policy, testing instructions), user support, and legal disclaimers.

outline.title: Google Play policy compliance across all areas
outline.summary: Detailed compliance with Device and Network Abuse, Deceptive Behavior, Malicious Behavior, and User Data policies.

outline.title: Misuse prevention through hardware and safety features
outline.summary: Explanation of how hardware requirements, technical knowledge barriers, and built-in safety features (backups, confirmations, read-only mode) prevent misuse.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/oSYGVOtAmN9w.jpg - Image 4 shows complex wiring and automotive work, visually supporting the idea of specialized equipment and the technical nature of the work, which helps prevent misuse.

outline.title: Developer commitment to transparency and compliance
outline.summary: Open communication with Google Play, responsive support, commitment to policy updates, post-launch monitoring, and request for approval.
